oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from the sister of John Lafayette Lemonds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From "MRD" to her brother, written following the fall of Atlanta on elaborate Union stationery with "Soldier's Dream" letterhead, Lemonds' sister laments that they "are surrounded by Yankies on all sides." She says: "We are a ruined people�they are forti-; fying [?] field with a considerable force and devastating the country making a clean sweep as they go." She speaks of the harsh military rule which has "sent all the Southern sympathizers to Canada" (possibly Fort Mackinac).
